today we'll introduce you to the key

SC supports a wide range of outbound

emails shipping notifications
newsletters account changes and
promotional content our many sces
customers trust the service to help them
deliver email at scale reliably and cost
effectively SCS also offers email
receiving capabilities however our
customers have frequently requested more
robust features for inbound emails in
response to this feedback we developed
the mail manager feature set Mail
Manager provides greater control over
inbound email at scale enabling more
comprehensive and effective email
management customers often face
challenges managing the vast amount of

while they're aware of email
applications internal mail relays and

infrastructure typically end user
inboxes get the most attention due to

email however many services involve

are much more complex and randomized
different departments May set up

Manager addresses this by providing an

and adding features from AWS or trusted

annually to develop robust stable and

management by centralizing email
management Mail Manager simplifies the

across your organization making it
easier to manage even the most complex

let's talk about security inbound emails
vary ranging from legitimate to
potentially harmful ones it's crucial
for organizations to be able to go
through incoming emails and filter out
those that don't meet their security
standards in this slide we will follow
the flow of inbound emails while
introducing Mail Manager features with a
focus on security so let's assume you
want to bolster email security for the
accounting department the accounting
department receives invoices from
suppliers and it's important to block or
centine malicious emails or emails that
don't meet certain security standards
The Mail Manager Journey starts with an
Ingress endpoint which receives emails
and it comes into two flavors the first
one is an open Ingress endpoint where
email sent to your domain resolves
directly to your Ingress endpoint with
no authentication required the second
one is an authenticated Ingress endpoint
which processes emails sent to your
domain from authorized senders with whom
you've shared your SMTP credentials such
as your own premise email servers an
Ingress endpoint irrespective of its
type needs to be associated with what we
call a traffic policy within the traffic
policy you determine which emails you
want to allow or block for example in
our case we might want to block emails
that have a TLS version lower than 1.2
and originate from an IP range of a
country where we don't have suppliers in
the next step is to go through a rule
set think of a rule set as a container
of an order set of rules that you create
to perform actions on your email each
rule consists of one or more conditions
that can be applied to a set of
properties such as mail from subject SPF
dkm and 11 others if the email meets the
conditions it proceeds to one or more
actions so in our case we can check if
SPF and dkm equals to pass and
accordingly send the email to the
accounting department let's move now
into what we call email addons which is
a collection of specialized security
tools from SCS approved providers that
can be used to manage the type of email
you allow into your Ingress endpoint and
to determine actions to be taken on
certain types of female at the moment of
this video being recorded Mail Manager
offers three add-ons the first one is
Trend microvirus scanning which is a
powerful file scanning engine that
classifies files as malicious suspected
or safe ensuring robust protection
against threats the second one is Abus
ex male intelligence which proactively
blocks over
99.6% of email threats providing a
reliable first line of defense with
minimal false positives and the third
one is Spam house domain block list
which rejects messages from domains with
poor reputation which enhances email
security by preventing suspicious emails
from entering your system let's now talk
about email archiving in certain
industries it's mandatory to store both
incoming and outgoing emails for
compliance purposes with Mail Manager
you can archive the emails you specify
coming into your Ingress endpoint as
well as providing a way to find your
archive messages through a read set of
advanced search filters and the ability
to export the results Mail Manager
archiving feature is part of the rule
set actions and can be combined with
other actions depending your
requirements for example in our case the
accounting department might want to
archive emails whose subject contains
invoice and store to an S3 everything
else for flexibility you can set up
multiple archives to store emails
ranging from a 3 month retention period
to permanent storage and encrypt them
using your own encryption
key this is a screenshot of the
archiving feature on the SCS console
searching for archived emails is simple
you can use filters based on sender
recipient and CC subject and attachments
presence archiving actions can also be
taken programmatically by the SCS email
man manager API or SDK some of the
actions include creating deleting
getting exporting getting a message or
its
content the third and last use case for
mail manager in this video is Route
process and
automate emails carry a wide range of
content and can be addressed to either a
person or a program for instance the
accounting department might receive
emails containing invoices that need to
be added to an invoicing system before
they are processed for payment with Mail
Manager you can identify emails with
attachments and store them in an Amazon
S3 bucket using S3 event notifications
you can invoke an AWS Lambda function to
read these emails and attachments after
processing them we with custom code the
invoices can be added to the invoicing
system automating data entry considering
that Mail Manager rule set can have
multiple actions emails with attachments
will also be sent to Amazon workmail
allowing accounting employees to double
check that the invoice entry in the
invoicing system has been done correctly
you can extend Mail Manager
functionality by utilizing additional
AWS services such as Amazon betro which
can be used to classify emails based on
